title: Robotics and Coding-Based Social-Emotional Learning (SEL) Integrated Language Expression Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of introductory programming concepts and robotics principles, intermediate reading/writing proficiency (capable of technical documentation comprehension and report writing)
context.additional_context: Collaborative project execution in BYOD environments, providing real-life problem-solving scenarios through VR simulations. Includes technical terminology organization and report writing guidelines to enhance learners' language expression skills

learning_goals: When performing robot control coding projects (3+ times), learners write a report in clear vocabulary and grammatical structure that meets at least 4 of 5 checklist items for self-awareness (emotional/cognitive monitoring) and self-management (time/resource planning) competencies.
While performing team-based coding tasks, learners assess social awareness and relationship management skills and apply effective communication (listening/speaking) strategies during collaboration.

Learners complete three collaborative robotics tasks (e.g., disaster response simulation) in a VR simulation environment, achieve an average of 4/5 points or higher on a 5-point scale for responsible decision-making (incorporating team input, considering risks, predicting outcomes), and express the process in structured text.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
